bt.Utils

Class Bencoder2

  • java.lang.Object
    • bt.Utils.Bencoder2

  • public final class Bencoder2
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses a Bencoded byte array and returns a combination of Map, List, ByteBuffer, and Integer objects.
    Author:
    Robert Moore II

    • Method Detail

      • getInfoBytes

        public static final java.nio.ByteBuffer getInfoBytes(byte[] torrent_file_bytes)
                                              throws BencodingException
        Extracts the bencoded 'info' dictionary from a metainfo torrent file.
        Parameters:
        torrent_file_bytes - the bencoded metainfo dictionary.
        Returns:
        a ByteBuffer containing the bencoded 'info' dictionary from the metainfo file.
        Throws:
        BencodingException - if the 'info' key is not contained in the decoded dictionary.

      • decode

        public static final java.lang.Object decode(byte[] bencoded_bytes)
                                     throws BencodingException
        Decodes a bencoded object represented by the byte array.
        Parameters:
        bencoded_bytes - the bencoded data to decode.
        Returns:
        either a Map, List, ByteBuffer, or Integer.
        Throws:
        BencodingException - if the bencoded data was improperly formatted.

      • decode

        private static final java.lang.Object[] decode(byte[] bencoded_bytes,
                        int offset)
                                        throws BencodingException
        Decodes a bencoded object represented by the byte array, starting at the specified offset.
        Parameters:
        bencoded_bytes - the bencoded data to decode.
        offset - the offset into bencoded_bytes at which to start decoding.
        Returns:
        a Map, List, ByteBuffer, or Integer.
        Throws:
        BencodingException - if the bencoded object in bencoded_bytes at offset offset is incorrectly encoded.

      • decodeInteger

        private static final java.lang.Object[] decodeInteger(byte[] bencoded_bytes,
                               int offset)
                                               throws BencodingException
        Decodes an integer from the byte array.
        Parameters:
        bencoded_bytes - the byte array of the bencoded integer.
        offset - the position of the 'i' indicating the start of the bencoded integer to be bdecoded.
        Returns:
        an Object[] containing an Integer offset and the decoded Integer, in positions 0 and 1, respectively
        Throws:
        BencodingException - if the bencoded integer in bencoded_bytes at offset offset is incorrectly encoded.

      • decodeString

        private static final java.lang.Object[] decodeString(byte[] bencoded_bytes,
                              int offset)
                                              throws BencodingException
        Decodes a byte string from the byte array
        Parameters:
        bencoded_bytes - the bencoded form of the byte string.
        offset - the offset into bencoded_bytes where the byte string begins.
        Returns:
        an Object[] containing an Integer offset and the decoded byte string (as a ByteBuffer), in positions 0 and 1, respectively
        Throws:
        BencodingException - if the bencoded object is incorrectly encoded.

      • decodeList

        private static final java.lang.Object[] decodeList(byte[] bencoded_bytes,
                            int offset)
                                            throws BencodingException
        Decodes a list from the bencoded byte array.
        Parameters:
        bencoded_bytes - the bencoded form of the list.
        offset - the offset into bencoded_bytes where the list begins.
        Returns:
        an Object[] containing an Integer offset and the decoded list (as a List), in positions 0 and 1, respectively
        Throws:
        BencodingException - if the bencoded object is incorrectly encoded.

      • decodeDictionary

        private static final java.lang.Object[] decodeDictionary(byte[] bencoded_bytes,
                                  int offset)
                                                  throws BencodingException
        Decodes a dictionary from the bencoded byte array.
        Parameters:
        bencoded_bytes - the bencoded form of the dictionary.
        offset - the offset into bencoded_bytes where the dictionary begins.
        Returns:
        an Object[] containing an Integer offset and the decoded dictionary (as a Map, in positions 0 and 1, respectively
        Throws:
        BencodingException - if the bencoded object is incorrectly encoded.

      • nextObject

        private static final int nextObject(byte[] bencoded_bytes,
             int offset)
        Determines the bencoded data type at bencoded_bytes[offset].
        Parameters:
        bencoded_bytes - the bencoded data.
        offset - the offset into bencoded_bytes that contains a bencoded object.
        Returns:
        the type of the bencoded object.
        See Also:
        DICTIONARY, LIST, INTEGER, STRING, INVALID

      • encode

        public static final byte[] encode(java.lang.Object o)
                           throws BencodingException
        Bencodes the specified object as a byte[].
        Parameters:
        o - the object to bencode.
        Returns:
        the bencoded form of the object.
        Throws:
        BencodingException - if o is not of type HashMap, ArrayList, Integer, or ByteBuffer.

      • encodeString

        private static final byte[] encodeString(java.nio.ByteBuffer string)
        Bencodes the specified byte string.
        Parameters:
        string - the byte string to bencode.
        Returns:
        a byte[] containing the bencoded form of the byte string.

      • encodeInteger

        private static final byte[] encodeInteger(java.lang.Integer integer)
        Bencodes the specified Integer.
        Parameters:
        integer - the Integer to bencode.
        Returns:
        a byte[] containing the bencoded form of the Integer.

      • encodeList

        private static final byte[] encodeList(java.util.ArrayList list)
                                throws BencodingException
        Bencodes the specified ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        list - the ArrayList to bencode.
        Returns:
        a byte[] containing the bencoded form of the ArrayList.
        Throws:
        BencodingException - if any of the objects in the list is not bencodable.

      • encodeDictionary

        private static final byte[] encodeDictionary(java.util.HashMap<java.nio.ByteBuffer,java.lang.Object> dictionary)
                                      throws BencodingException
        Bencodes the specified HashMap.
        Parameters:
        dictionary - the HashMap to bencode.
        Returns:
        a byte[] containing the bnecoded form of the HashMap.
        Throws:
        BencodingException - if any of the objecdts in the map is not bencodable.
